subject: Set static & dhcp sent ntp server ip on ethernet obj
commitMessage:
Set static & dhcp sent ntp server ip on ethernet obj

Currently there is no way to differentiate between the Static
and DHCP assigned NTP servers at dbus

This commit adds StaticNTPServers peroperty to hold the static
configuration of NTP servers. This is a read-write property.
The existing NTPServer propery will hold both static and DHCP
assigned NTP servers. This is a read-only property.

The static and dhcp sent ntp server details are present in the
dbus object hosted by systemd-timesyncd service (mentioned in
Tested By section).

In this change, networkd fetches the ntp server details from the
timesyncd dbus object and set the "NTPServers" property with dhcp sent
ip and "StaticNTPServers" will be set from the configuration file.

Tested By:

* Change the ntp server ips in dhcp config file & restart dhcpd
* timesyncd dbus object contains the new list of ips as below:

busctl introspect org.freedesktop.timesync1 /org/freedesktop/timesync1
NAME                                TYPE      SIGNATURE          RESULT/VALUE                             FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable interface -                  -                                        -
.Introspect                         method    -                  s                                        -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer           interface -                  -                                        -
.GetMachineId                       method    -                  s                                        -
.Ping                               method    -                  -                                        -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties     interface -                  -                                        -
.Get                                method    ss                 v                                        -
.GetAll                             method    s                  a{sv}                                    -
.Set                                method    ssv                -                                        -
.PropertiesChanged                  signal    sa{sv}as           -                                        -
org.freedesktop.timesync1.Manager   interface -                  -                                        -
.FallbackNTPServers                 property  as                 4 "time1.google.com" "time2.google.com"… const
.Frequency                          property  x                  0                                        -
.LinkNTPServers                     property  as                 1 "1.1.1.1"                              -
.NTPMessage                         property  (uuuuittayttttbtt) 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 4 0 0 0 0 0 1844453508490… emits-change
.PollIntervalMaxUSec                property  t                  2048000000                               const
.PollIntervalMinUSec                property  t                  32000000                                 const
.PollIntervalUSec                   property  t                  2048000000                               -
.RootDistanceMaxUSec                property  t                  5000000                                  const
.ServerAddress                      property  (iay)              2 4 1 1 1 1                              -
.ServerName                         property  s                  "1.1.1.1"                                -
.SystemNTPServers                   property  as                 0                                        const

* Since network configuration has changed, the service restarts and
ntp server details are loaded from timesyncd dbus object & config file,
and are set in dbus objects hosted by networkd.

command: busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.Network /xyz/openbmc_project/network/eth0
         busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.Network /xyz/openbmc_project/network/eth1

* Ethernet interface network config files will be updated with NTP=<ip addresses> under [Network]

command: cat /etc/systemd/network/00-bmc-eth0.network
         cat /etc/systemd/network/00-bmc-eth1.network

Signed-off-by: Asmitha Karunanithi <asmitk01@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: If8b1b3ed2afb531f179e00da173f6f86a1bf0c18

I think output of this command need not be pasted in the commit message. This makes it too long

Just explaining the logic should be good enough. 
Like:
Ethernet interface network config files will be updated with the NTP=<ip addresses>
Please fix the CI failure as well
Is this enabled by default on BMC ?
Yes, as I see it here: https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-phosphor/recipes-core/systemd/systemd_%25.bbappend#L17
This can be a new method - loadNtpServers

Which config file? 
If you mentioning about network file, Then we don't need to update the config file for the info which BMC(Dhcp client) receives through DHCP server.

Yes. bmc-00-eth<0/1>.network

>Then we don't need to update the config file for the info which BMC(Dhcp client) receives through DHCP server.

Ack
How do we know that the NTP servers are for the eth0 or eth1 interface?

I thought ntp server details were not specific to any interface as such (eth0/1)

Please correct me if i am wrong.

You can have ntp server specific to the intreface.
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.network.html

Yes. systemd has it at interface level. But redfish does not have an interface level command to PATCH the nameservers. Its at the system level, and that made us to copy the same value to both interfaces. 

We need a way from redfish to allow setting the ntp servers at EthernetInterface schema. Not at the NetworkProtocol schema.

On second thought - Ratan, should the NTP server be at interface level ? or its good to be at system level ? 
NTP is for the time management and it does not matter if the time comes down to the system via eth0 or eth1. Single time should be given to the system.
Example - If both interfaces have different NTP servers attached, then which NTP server's time is going to be consumed by the system?

@sunitha: Can you get the opinion from the systemd-networkd by opening a issue in the systemd-repo?
Phopshor-networkd is a wrapper over systemd-networkd, We are not taking our decision by looking at the external interface level protocols. 

>  But redfish does not have an interface level command to PATCH the nameservers.

Redfish is having the interface level command to patch the nameservers.

> On second thought - Ratan, should the NTP server be at interface level ? or its good to be at system level ? 
NTP is for the time management and it does not matter if the time comes down to the system via eth0 or eth1. Single time should be given to the system.

Your point is correct but that should be same for the namserver and the ntpserver both.

I think we need to get some opinion from the systemd-networkd.

How we are going to differentiate between the static NTP servers v/s NTP servers got through DHCP.

Please have a look at how it has been done for the NameServers.

When i tested, i saw that there was one static ntp server ip set using patch on NetworkProtocol.

When there was dhcp ip sent, as per above comments, only static ip was stored in the network config file. That way one can differentiate between static & dhcp (one in config file is static and the others are dhcp)? Or is there any other way?

Also, may i know if there is a path where we read static ntp servers other than this config file?

My query was regarding the https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Network/EthernetInterface.interface.yaml
Where we have
 1) nameservers: which shows all the namse servers configured on the system(Read only).
2) Static Nameservers: which shows all the static nameservers configured on the system(Read/write).

Now when you have a single D-bus property how you are going to differentiate? Say user wants to patch the Ntp servers property and delete the Ntp servers which BMC got it through DHCP.

How we are going to control that?
I had pushed https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/50887 for the same Ratan. Please have a look at that commit and we can get that in first
It should load the DHCP provided IPs from the timesyncd and the static ips from the configuration file. There should not be a write to config call here

As I said in the dbus interface review, this attempted validation is wrong. it makes total sense for a DHCP server but it does not make sense for an NTP server. 

DHCP is the name resolution so you cannot put a name here and it MUST be an up address. 
NTP uses name resolution and is, in practice, rarely an IP address.
elog already throws. There is no need to return here.
Once the dbus interfaces change go in, the CI will pass.
I merged the phosphor-dbus-interfaces change but it appears that you have testcase failure that need to be worked out.
Please add tests for read-only NTPServers property. SET should throw NotAllowed error. GET should return the servers list from timesyncd
Please move the bus.call() inside the try/catch block, or this change causes the network app to core dump in non-NTP systems (TimeSyncMethod set to Manual),

I am not getting why we are expecting a call getNTPServerFromTimeSyncd()?
We have not called the loadNtpserver on the interface which further calls this function(getNTPServerFromTimeSyncd())

Since this property contains both static and dhcp sent ntp server ips, i thought having this call here would be appropriate.
If it shouldn't be here, then should it be just #224 and #227 in this testcase?

No, What I am asking that you have mentioned that the test cases is Expecting this call getNTPServerFromTimeSyncd, 

How the getNTPServerFromTimeSyncd is going to be called if we are creating the interface object?
Please move this line into try block as well
Please push a separate commit for moving this into the try block
You need to mock getNTPServerFromTimeSyncd only
The latest PS contains the changes
The latest PS contains the changes
this source code just returns the ntpServers list. So no need to test this.
The latest PS contains the changes

Hi Reviewers,
Can you please give your votes for this change?

Thanks.
I have little opinion on the changes since PS9 as they are mostly test cases.  They seem reasonable.  I left a minor nit but otherwise +1.
nit: Typically we'd do this as 'ntpServers'.  I did a bunch of work last year in the sdbusplus bindings to ensure we never had unusual cases like this because they're so jarring to read.
Hi Maintainers, Are we good here to get this to merge?
Waiting on another change. I will submit this once that's done.
Yet not submitted, any issues which you got it.

Read-only flag on the NTPServers dbus property was removed by https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/commit/998c7beda3100c37b8931e8e2fafe7d40311297a . That will need changes in this commit as well.
I just pushed https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/54797 now. We will need a property name change here in this commit as per that.
Please share your comments/votes on the new change.
